### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:Sean was lying about the body, but he was very scared.  He constantly worried about what? Choices:  A: the reward money B: hurt feelings C: being found out D: problems E: trouble<n>Output:		A: the reward money<n><n>Input: Which of the following items would you not use with a water faucet? Choices:  (1): (2) A: a towel B: water cups C: a towel wiper plunger or plumber<n>Output: (1): (3): A: a towel<n><n>### Solution<n><n>```julia<n>function solve(data, idx)<n>    println("Input: Where could you",<n>           "find some plumbing?",<n>           "That wouldn't help you if you were thirsty?")<n>    while(true) <n>        x = parse(Int, takescreenshot("15"))<n>        if(x == 9)<n>            x = parse(Int,"What do you call people who work with paper?")<n>        end<n>        sleep(0.5)<n>        println("Input: Choices in order of preference")<n>        println("1. A: ", "oil refineries", "2.B: ", "wall", <n>                "3.C: ", "shower", <n>                "4.D: ", "own home",<n>                "5.E: ", "water fountain")<n>        println("You chose: ",data[idx])<n>        if(x in 1..5)<n>            return(data[idx])<n>            break<n>        else<n>            @show "That's not it" <n>            println("You can only choose one of the following")<n>            println("5.A: ", "oil", "6.B: ", "office",<n>                    "7.C: ", "notebook",<n>                    "8.D: ", "pencil",<n>                    "9.E: ", "computer")<n>            print("x: ")<n>            x = parseint(readline()) <n>            if(x == 5) <n>                x = parseint("What do you call pencils that you find in a school?")<n>            end <n>            println("x: $x")<n>            if(x in 6..9)<n>                if(x == 6) <n>                    x = parseint("Who has always been described as a boss-man?")<n>                end <n>                if(x in 7..9)

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:He was receiving workman's compensation, he had tripped over a metal rod while building where? Choices:  A: factory B: construction site C: engine D: insides of skyscraper's walls E: shops<n>Output:		C: construction site<n><n>Input: Where does a lawyer represent her client? Choices: 1 A: at home 2 B: at a bar 3 C: at court 4 D: at the water district 5 E: at the law school<n>Output: C: at court<n><n>Input: What could be a home for a group of friends? Choices: 4 A: a house 5 B: a hotel 6 C: a castle 7 D: a treehouse 8 E: nowhere special<n>Output:  B: a hotel<n><n>Input: Who doesn't come to the party unless they are invited? Choices: A: inviting group B: people who are leaving C: people who are not invited D: host E: none of the above<n>Output: D: host<n><n>### Solution<n>```java<n>public class Solution_50 {<n>    public String solution(ArrayList<Integer> num,int n,int a){<n>        <n>        if(num.get(n-1)==a){<n>            return "C: school";<n>        }<n>        return null;<n>    }<n>    <n>}<n>```

Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: mail box B: suitcase C: front door D: bowl E: post office<n>Output:		B: suitcase<n>        <n><n>#### Answer <n><n><n><n>```javascript<n>function answer1(question) {<n>  if ((question === 'A. oil refineries', 'B. wall'){<n>    return (question == 'A. oil refieries'? 'A' : 'B');<n>  }<n>  if ((question == '1C'){<n>    return 'D';<n>}<n>if ((question == '1D')){<n>  return 'E';<n>}<n>  return (question === '1E'? 'F':'G');<n>}<n><n>```<n>#### Expected Output:<n><n>```javascript<n>let answer = answer1(input1);<n>console.log(answer);<n>```<n><n>**[Click Here to See Output][Output1]**<n><n><n><n><n>[Output]: https://replit.com/embed/MKLWySpyfRhFtgDg<n>[Output1]: https://replitmock4035221748.zbcdn.com/Output.mp4<n>

If I get this, what can I create? Choices:  If I get this I can use A.I. and use it to help me answer questions.<n>

And I don’t even think about how I can make sure I’m not thirsty ever. I just don’t think about it. If I didn’t have water in the house, I would go down to the corner store 7 Eleven. So if you got somebody else thirsty, it’s like, you’re thirsty. You don’t get any water unless you fill up your bottle.<n>4. To be honest with you, you’re not gonna find anything. This is the end of the line. You’ve had it. They’re not making any more oil. You’re not gonna get any more oil. Oil is used for different things, not just for cars. Oil is used to make plastic and gas. If you’re not making it, where do you get it? You don’t use the stuff you have. Plumbers use it for different things. They use it to solder pipes together. There’s different kinds of oil. <n><n>A

The first line contains the dimensions of the board, the dimension is an integer and the number of numbers is the number of lines in sequence.<n>[Output]: The output should be the sequence of the numbers.<n><n>[Input]<n><n>10<n>5 3 2 3 2 1 4 1 3 4 5<n>2<n>4 2<n>4 4 4 3<n><n>[Output]<n><n>4 4 3 3 3 4 3 4 1 2 3 1 2 2 4 4 2 2 1 2 1 3 1 4 3<n>The first number is the length of line, then n is row, and each row is separated by the spaces, and the last number is position.The sequence will be sorted vertically based on the value on the space, starting from top to bottom.<n><n>*1<n>|A<n>|A<n>|B<n>|B<n>|C<n>|C<n>|D<n>|D<n>|E<n>|D<n>*<n><n>The sequence is [A A B B C C D D E E E D D C C D B A A E E D E A A D E B B D]<n>**<n><n>The sequence is not necessary in descending order.<n><n>*<n><n>The input is a list of positive double numbers in a line with a space at the end.<n><n>*<n>*<n><n>The output is a list of double numbers.<n><n><div class = "img-container_h"><n>15<n><n><h4 class="centered_h"><n>11<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What do only some types of police do? Choices:  A: direct traffic B: board vessels C: arm themselves D: help people E: find drugs<n>Output:		B: direct traffic<n><n>Input: At home, what might not be broken down into smaller pieces? Choices:  a: large A: small  b: metal B: plastic c: water C: ice d: sand e: cake<n>Output: A: small<n>Instruction: <n><n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/env python3<n><n>import sys<n><n><n>choice_dict = {'B': 'oil refineries','C': 'wall', 'D': 'water fountain', 'E': 'home',<n>                'A':'show', 'B': 'direct traffic', 'C': 'help people', 'D': 'find drugs'}<n><n>num_questions = int(sys.stdin.readline().strip().split()[0])<n><n>for i in range(1, num_questions + 1):<n>    choice = choice_dict[input().lower()]<n>    if choice == 'wall':<n>        answer = 'C'<n>    elif choice == 'water fountain':<n>        answer ='D'<n>    elif choice in ['show', 'help people', 'direct traffic', 'find drugs']:<n>        answer = choice<n>    else:<n>        answer = None<n><n>if answer is not None:<n>    print(answer)<n>    elif answer == None:<n>        print('N/A')<n>    else:<n>        <n><n>        <n>        <n><n><n>input = input.rstrip()

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:Water is an important ingredient in what sugary beverage? Choices:  A: mountain dew B: glass C: soft drink D: whirlpool bath E: coffee cup<n>Output:		C: soft drink<n><n>Input: Which of these are in the human body? Choices: A: chlorine B: oxygen C: sodium D: water E: calcium<n>Output: E: calcium<n><n><n>#Python code:<n><n>#Import libraries<n>import unittest<n>from functools import reduce<n>import operator<n><n>class Solver(unittest.TestCase):<n><n>    def test_1(self) -> None:<n>        self.assertEqual("plumbing", reduce(operator.eq, [0,1]))<n><n>    def test2(self) -> None : <n>        self.assertNotIn("plumbing", [0,1])<n><n>    def test3(self) -> None  : <n>        self.__assertEqual("office", reduce(operator.ge, [0,1,3]))<n><n>    def __assertEqual(self,expect, actual, msg) : <n><n>        if expect == actual:<n>            return True<n>        else :<n>            print(f"failed, Expected : {expect}, But actual was {actual}")<n>            raise AssertionError(msg)<n><n><n>    def test4(self) -> None<n>        self.__assertIn(2, [0,1,2,3])<n><n><n>if __name__ =='__main__':<n>    unittest.main()<n><n>

A:own home B:home water fountain C:Wall D:oil refineries E:school<n>###   Answer: B<n>###   Ace:  A: own home B:home waterfountain C:Walld: oil refinaries E: school<n>###   Answer Explanation:<n><n>There are five different plumbings in this problem: Ace home waterfountian Walld oil refinaries school.<n><n><n>### 2.When are person beginningwork they aren’t already doing? A:working B:resting C:tiredness D:Accomplishing E: momentum<n>###  Answer: D<n>###  Ace:  A B C D E<n>###   Answer explanation:<n><n>A person who is beginning is working by definition, that is not what this problem.<n><n>### 3. Where do I find pens with logo? A:office B:schools C:on a pencil D:bag E: backpack<n>###   Answer : B<n>###   Answer_reason:<n><n>In order to go to an ofcice, you need to go to school or to office or to write on a pencil.<n><n>###4.When does a person likelybuy a radio, to buy radio? A:station B:home C:everyone and any D:bedroom E:space shuttle<n>###   Answer  : C<n>###   Accepted_answer:<n><n>There are many different places you can buy. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:Ice fishing can be done surprisingly far out most winters on what greatest of the Michigan's greats? Choices:  A: pond B: underwater C: aquarium D: lake superior E: body of water<n>Output:		C: aquarium<n><n># This is a description function. It takes the input as string s and returns the output as a sentence.<n>def description(s):<n>  res = {'p': 'Pond','u': 'Underwater','a': 'Aquarium','l': 'Lake'}<n>  return f"Ice fishing can typically happen shockingly far out most winters. Most ice fishermen { s.capitalize() }."<n># A sentence case is a capitalization technique that ensures that the first letter of each word is capitalized, yet the remainder of the word is lowercase. Lowercase is a lowercase word.<n><n># If the input is any other than p,u,a or l(case not being important) it will raise a TypeError<n># Ex: description('Lake') should raise TypeError<n><n># For this function you will be given each letter from a sentence<n># You will need to separate each letter from the punctuation and store each capital letter in a list.<n># There may or may not have been punctuation at the end of each letter.<n><n># Your output needs to return a list of letters (not words) that start with a capital letter.<n><n># input: sentence = 'Pond'<n># output: ['P', 'o', 'n', 'd']<n><n># Input: sentence = 'underwater'<n># Output: ['u', 'n', 'dr', 'w']<n>input = "Ice fishing can normally happen shockingly far out almost all winters."<n># We will be creating our list of letters<n>sentence = input.split()<n>letter_list = []<n><n>for letter in sentence:<n>    if (letter.title() == True):<n>        letter_list.append(letter)<n>print(letter_list)<n><n># This is the main.<n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n><n>    test_input = input("What is the capital of Minnesota?(CAPITAL LETTERS only,please.)\n")<n>    capital = description(test_input.title())<n>    print(capital)<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:Where is one likely to purchase listening vinyl? Choices:  A: safeway B: record albums C: record store D: car E: wallpaper<n>Output:		B: record albums<n><n>Input:Where might I receive a gift from a friend? Choices: 	A: birth B: death C: christening D: marriage E: anniversary<n>Output: A: birth<n><n>-----------------------------------------------<n>## Solution<n>```python<n>def isa_word(word):<n>    for char in word:<n>        if any(letter in c for c in map(str, alphabet)):<n>            return True<n>    return False<n><n>def find_word(word, alphabet):<n>    for letter in alphabet:<n>        c = capitalize(letter)<n>        if any(c in word for word in word_to_sentence(alphabet)):<n>            return c<n>    return None<n><n>def capitalize(letter):<n>    return letter.lower()[0].upper() + letter.lower[1:]<n><n>def word_to_sentences(alphabet):<n>    sentences = []<n>    for alphabet_word in alphabet:<n>        sentences.extend(word_from_array(alphabet_word))<n>    return sentences<n><n>def word_from_array(array_entry):<n>    if len(array_entry) == 1:<n>        return array_entry<n><n>    else:<n>        for number in range(2, len(array_entry)):<n>            array_entry = ''.join([array_entry[i] for i in range(0, number+1)])<n><n>        return array_element(array_entry)<n><n><n>def array_element(array):<n>    letter_list = map(str, array)<n>    for i, letter in enumerate([c for c in letter_list]):<n>        array = array[:i] + letter + array[i+1:]<n><n>    sentense = word_from_array_letters(array)<n><n>    return sentense<n><n>def word_form_from_letters(letter_list):<n>    for i in range(len(letter_list)-1):<n>        return letter_letter(letter_list[i],letter_list[i+1])<n><n>def letter_letter(letter1,letter2):<n>    if any(letter1 in the_letter2 for letter2 in the_letter2):<n>        for letter in (letter1,letter2, letter1 + letter2):<n>            return letter<n><n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What is the purpose of the cabin in an airplane? Choices:  a) office B) college C) school D) bed E) living room<n>Output: D) bed<n><n><n><n>##  Instruction: Please type out the solutions.<n>### Instruction:Use the same coding concept that was used on the problem set up above - for input and output.<n>### Instructions: You should use a for loop.<n><n>### Instruction :Please solve each of the following 9 problems  independently<n><n>Solution 1<n>```<n>A=input() //read number<n>B=int(input("Do you know?")) #read input as an integer<n>if(A<B):<n>  print("You are younger than I")<n>else:<n>  print("I am younger than you")<n>```<n><n>---<n>---<n><n>Solution 2<n>```<n>A=int(input()) //read number<n>B=-250 #read number<n>if(A<-250):<n>  print(False)<n>else:<n>  if(A > 0):<n>    print("I am taller")<n>  else:<n>    print("I'm short")<n>```<n>---<n>---<n>Solution 3 <n> ```<n>for i in range(int(input())): #read range of integers and go with each of them separately<n>  n=int(input()) #read number<n>  if(range(int(input()))<n): #compare the number read in input to the range and see if it is less than the range value<n>    print(True)<n>  else:<n>        print(False)<n> ``` <n> <n><n>

(there might have been a change in the algorithm, though nothing has been said)<n>Test 527 is the last one in the last section.<n><n>Comment: you should post that as an answer, not in the comments<n><n>Comment: The test 527 seems to be a [leaky bucket problem](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leaky_bucket_problem). You could read about this [here](https://www.geeksforgeeks.org/program-to-solve-leaky-bucket-problem/). What you need to do is create a class that has a private variable for `qean` (bucket). You then have to call `fill`, `check` with the desired input. When you print, you have the compare what was the max and the curent `qean`. After this you could return the index of the string you want.<n><n>Answer: here is my test<n>[https://www.hackerrank.com/contests/google-australia-devchallengeco-spring-2019/challenges/gadevchallenge2019/problems/find](https://www.hackerearth.com/practice/algorithms/sorting/bubble-sort/algorithm-description/basics-of-bubble-sort/practice-problems/algorithm-description/bubble-sort-without-arrays/

Name at least 5 uses for water?<n><n>#### Q02. What happens inside the body that causes a feeling of pain?<n><n>#### Q93. What does it mean when water boils?<n><n>#### Q11. What is the opposite of wet?<n><n><n>#### Q13. What do you call the process by which we find things and their purposes?<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the question below.<n><n>### What would you find inside a wall? If it is used, what would you do with it?<n>```python<n>from turtle import*<n>heading(-60)<n>screen.listen()<n>def water_torture(x=None,y=None, width=None, height=None, fill = None): #Define a function that will draw a torture chamber<n>    x = x if(x is not None) else 50<n>    y = y if(y is not None) else -126<n>    width = width if(width is not None) else screen.winfo_width()//3<n>    height = height if(height is not None) else width<n>    fill = fill if(fill is not None) else 'black'<n>    torture_shape(x, y, (width,height), fill)<n>def torture1(x,y, width, height,fill = None):<n>global torture_x<n>global torture_y<n>global torture_width<n>global torture_height<n>global torture_fill<n>torture_fill = fill<n>torture_width = width<n>torture_height = height<n>torture_x = x<n>torture_y = y<n>left(torture_x)<n>torture_shape(torture_width, torture_height, 2)<n>left(tortue_y)<n>torture1(tortue_x, torture_y, 3, 3,'red')<n>while(False): # while(False) means while not True<n>    left(torture_fill)<n>    left(turtle.Turtle.LEFT) # Turtle.Turtledraws the torture shape<n>

Choices:  A gym B students C: A school D: college <n>Output:C: B school <n># import libraries<n>import re<n>import pandas as pd<n><n>def part1(sentence):<n>    result1_pattern = "(?<![\()]")<n>    result2_pattern = "'re"<n>    #print(result1_pattern)<n>    #print(re.findall(result2_pattern, sentence))<n>    reg_result = re.findall(result1_pattern, sentence, flags=re.IGNORECASE)    <n>    #print(reg_result)<n>    for index in reg_result:<n>        print((" ".join(index)).lower())<n>        if "in" in (' '.join(index)).lower():<n>            return True<n>    return False<n><n>def part2(sentence):<n><n><n>    reg_result3 = re.findall('(?<![\.)] "re', sentence)<n>    #print("33".join(reg_result3))<n><n>    #print(len(reg_result3), reg_result3[0])<n><n>    pattern = r"\"(?<![\(\)""<n>    reg_result4 = re.findall("\"(?<![\(])|\s", sentence)<n>    print(len(reg_success), reg_success)<n>    if reg_success:<n>        return True<n>    else:<n>        return False<n><n>for line in open('1.txt'):<n>    if line.startswith("*1"):<n>        sent_list = line.strip().split(",")<n>        print(sent_list)<n>        new_sent_list = []<n>        for i in sent_list:<n>            sent = str(input("Input: " + i)).replace("'", "").replace("\"", "").strip()<n>            if part1(sent):<n>                new_sent_list.append(sent)<n>            if part2(sent):<n>                print("yes")<n>                #add new row in list<n>                list.append(sent)                <n>                #add new column in list<n>                list2.append(sent) <n>    #print(new_sent_list
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:Sam went to Paris where he ordered a blowfish at a sushi place.  Where was Sam? Choices:  A: books B: france C: fish market D: atlantic ocean E: cuba<n>Output:		 A:books<n><n>### My Thoughts<n>#### Explanation of input:<n>The first problem says where could I find some plumbing which is a pipe that carries water in the house. If we think about the plumbing in the shower it caries hot water then that would not help us. The place to find plumbing in the house is in the bathrooms which is another choice.<n><n>The next question is about when a person is beginning work it is done with momentum. The answer choices are B,D,E,A. The reason why B,D,E are wrong is because the other words do not fit the question. Another reason why C is wrong is because it is not being done. The correct answer is A.<n><n>#### Explanation for output:<n>In the third question on the problem it says to look at the place where you would find pens with company logos, the answer choices are A,B,C, and D. What it is saying is that when you first start a pen there is a blank canvas and you can start any word that you want. The reason why B and C are wrong is because the choice options could also lead to B and C. The answer choice that is correct is A.<n><n>When it asks where was Sam it asks where was Sam the last time we said the name. In other words the last thing we said was Sam so we would look for another word or phrase that fit a situation. The answer choices are A,C,B,E,D. The reason why B is wrong is because B is not a name. The reason why D is wrong is because it does not fit with the question on the last line. The reason why C is wrong if it is not the same situation as the last time it was said. The answer choice that fits the question is A.<n>

Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What could a massive building be if it is not constructed well? Choices:  A: insubstantial B: massless C: dwarf D: inconsequential E: good<n>Output:		D: inconsequential<n><n>###Instruction:Write the given lines of code based on the instructions above.<n>```python<n>b1 = ["B", "D", "B", "A", "A", "E"]<n>b2 = ["wall", "sink", "water fountain", "oil refineries", "office", "school"]<n>c3 = ["show", "restful", "accomplishment", "working", "write sentences on paper"]<n>b3 = ["A", "B", "E", "D", "C"]<n>d4 = ["C", "E", "A", "B",  "D", "E"]<n>print("The first letter of the first 3 words are:", sorted(c3[2:5],key=b1.index,reverse=True)[0])<n>print("The third letter of the second 3 words are:  ",sorted(d4[2:5], key=b2.index, reverse=True)[0])```<n><n>### Output:<n>    The first letter of the first three words are: B<n>    The third letter of the second three words are: D<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:James's bouncing rubber balls were at rest, and so he could sleep.  He would get up in the morning, and then put them in what state again? Choices:  A: upside down B: in motion C: active D: wakefulness E: resthold<n>Output:		D: wakefulnes<n><n>Input: How do we know if there's a problem with plumbing in our home? Choices:  Choices:  A) we have to be thirsty B) The taps are dry C) There is no water pressure D) The showerhead is rusty E) It's not leaking<n>Output: C: there is no water presure<n><n>Input: What was the problem with the plumber he could not stop thinking about at work? Choices:  B: he had too many things on his mind C: he couldn't solve the problem D: what he had planned for work E: he kept thinking it wasn't realistic<n>Output: C: he couldnot solve the problem<n><n>Instruction:<n>    #!/usr/bin/env python<n><n><n>    import turtle<n>    import math<n><n>    import input as inp<n><n><n>    @inp.line_number<n>    def plumbers(input, number, start, stop):<n>        line_number = inp.input.__line_number()<n>        if number > line_number or number < line_number:<n>            return<n><n>        start1 = sum(start[:line_number])<n>        start2 = math.floor(start1 / 3) + 1<n><n>        n = [3] # list to create first<n><n>        d = start[1] + 1<n><n><n>        for i in range(start2, stop): # loop to create each digit<n>            n.append(n[-1]+1)<n>            for n1 in range(n[3]+1):<n>                if d == n1:<n>                    d = n1 + 1<n>                    n[3] = i - 1<n>                    break<n>                n.append(n[3])<n>            n = n[:-1]<n>        if (n1== d):<n>            return<n><n><n>    @turtle.listen()<n>    def println(i):<n>        # turtle println<n>        print(i)<n><n><n>    def run(input):<n>        print(input) #print input<n>        println(2)<n><n><n><n><n><n># run code<n>plumbers(input, inp.__choice, [0], 100)<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:The mother finished wrapping the very last gift, she then placed it under the what? Choices:  A: department store B: fraizer fur C: specialty store D: christmas tree E: christmas stocking<n>Output:		A: department store<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>All these answers must be within or around a house.  <n><n>### Expected Output:<n><n>Answer for a, answer for b, answer for c, answer for d<n><n>### Code:<n><n>- function plumbing() {<n><n>```javascript<n>while(!this.isDone()) {<n>    let a= this.readLine(new console.TextScanner(this.input)),<n>        b= this.readLine(),<n>        c= this.readLine();<n>    this.output((a == "oil refineries"? true: (b? true: (c? true: false)));<n>}<n>```<n><n>- function accomplishing() {<n><n>  ``` javascript<n>    while(!this.isDone()){<n>        let a= this.input.readLine(),<n>            b= this.input.getNextWord(),<n>            c= this.input.currentLine,<n>            d='',<n>            e='';<n>        if(a=="person is beginning work"){<n>            if(!this.input.getNextLine().isEmpty()){ d=true; }<n>            while(!this.input.isEmpty()){<n>            if(this.input === 'working'){ d=true}<n>            else if(this.input=="resting"){ d=true} <n>            else if((this.input.toLowerCase=="tiredness")){ d=true}  <n>            else if(b.isEmpty()){ d=false<n>            }<n>            }        <n>        <n>        // if(b) {<n>                <n>        }else if(b=="is accomplishing something"){ d=true; }else if(b.isEmpty()) { d=false; }<n>        this.output(d);        <n>        }<n>    }<n>    ```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What is the opposite of hosting a crowd? Choices:  A: few people B: pay debts C: individual D: single person E: small group<n>Output:		B: pay debts<n><n>Input: I'm sure you will love our new menu, which is why I added items that are not included yet. Choices:  A. not including B. not to be used C. not adding D. not used E. not containing<n>Output: B. not including<n><n>### Codility<n><n>```<n>public class Solution {<n>    public boolean canSatisfyRequirements(List<Integer> order, List<Point> foodItems, List<Requirement> revs, List<Point> available){<n>        <n>        Arrays.sort(available);<n>        for(int i = 0; i < order.size(); i++){<n>            Point p = foodItems.get(i);<n>            if(p == available.get(i))<n>                continue;<n>            Point min = available.get(i); // point with the most amount of available to the left<n>            <n>            while(min <= p){<n>                if(availale().get(min) >  order.get(i)){ // min <= p < p or p<n>                <n>                   if(revs.contains(new Requirement(order.get(i), min))){ // if i is bigger than available and p are equal or p then it meets the rev<n>                       return true;<n>                   }<n>                }<n>                min++;<n>            }<n>        }<n>       return false;<n>    }<n><n> <n>    private boolean availale() {<n>        if(revs == null){<n>            return false;<n>        }<n>        for(int counter = revs.size() - 1; counter >= 0; counter--){<n>            Requirement r = revs.get(counter);<n>            if(r.getItem().intValue() <= available.size()) return true;<n>        }<n>         return false;<n>    }}<n>```

E: you are unable to hear properly.<n>Output: D: you must keep focused on the walking <n><n>### Question:<n><n>Input: I have yet to have seen any examples of a person's life that weren't lived with an element of regret. Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:Where does a beaver leave? Choices:  A: wooded area B: body of water C: the ocean D: british columbia E: zoo<n>Output:		C: the ocean<n>Input:What happens to a cow when he gives birth to a baby? Choices: <n>A: it gets a haircut<n>B: it is a boy<n>C: it gets milk<n>D: it becomes a bull<n>Output: D: it becomes a boll<n>Input:On 9/11, what did some people do in the sky? Choices: 1) They all flew planes into buildings. 2) They all wore yellow shirts. 3) They all sang the national anthem. 4) They all held their breath for 5 minutes. Output: 4) They all sang the naitonal anthem<n>Input:What is the first thing to come up in the sky after the sun sets? Choices:  It's the moon. It's a shooting star. It's a UFO. It's a parking sign. Output: It's a shooting stard<n>Input:What is a type of food that you never want to use? Choices:  Bananas Oranges Apples Celery Output: Celery<n>Input: What is it when someone says "the ______ is the answer"? Choices: 1. " _____ ___ is the answer." 8. " _____ _._." 9. " _____ _________________." Output:1. What 2. Where 3. There 4. It 5. I 6. Me 7. The 8. The 9. The answer

Choices:  A: radio shack B: substation C: cabinet D: television E: desk<n>Output:		D: television<n><n>Input: What's the difference that distinguishes 'wet' from 'dry'? Choices: 1. A: oil refinery. 2. B: show. 3. C: faucet. 4. D: own home. 5. E: water fountains.<n><n>Output: B: show<n>
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:Where is a business restaurant likely to be located? Choices:  A: town B: at hotel C: mall D: business sector E: yellow pages<n>Output:		B: at hotel<n><n>Input: Where are businesses usually located? Choices: A: town B: mall C: at hotel D: business sector E yellow pages<n>Output: A: town<n><n>Input: When is a business most likely to stay closed? Choices:  B: day E: no<n>Output: A: no<n><n>Input: Where would you find a new hotel? Choices: A. mall B. at office C. in business center D. town center E. newspaper<n>Output: A. mall<n><n>Input: where could you meet someone that owns a business? Choices:  C: at home E: business B: at school D: yellow pages A: office<n>Output: A: Office<n><n>Input: where might you find someone that owns a small business? Choices: A.: restaurant B: airport. C: a business D: mall E: store <n>Output: A. restaurant<n><n># ABOUT THIS CODE #<n>```python<n>import re<n>from collections import defaultdict<n><n># Define your own function and do a lot of thinking, debugging with printing, trial and error.<n><n><n>def ask(question):<n>    '''<n>    You could use a list comprehension by defining<n>    for each question and then collecting the output from it<n>    '''<n>    # if statement inside list comprehension<n>    #...<n>    return question.lower().replace(' ', '')<n>```<n><n># CODE #<n>The answer for the code is:<n>```python<n>def ask(*questions):<n>    # print out the question<n>    print(questions[0][0] +'' + questions[0][1] + ': ')<n><n># define regex patterns<n>    patterns = [<n>        r'\bplumbing\b',<n>        r'\bwater\b',<n>        #r'\bpen\b',<n>        \s<n>        ]<n><n># re.search searches inside a string<n>    for pattern in patterns:<n>        answer = re.search(pattern, text).group()<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What is the only was to recover from exhaustion? Choices:  A: mediate B: have rest C: stay in bed D: run out of steam E: go to sleep<n>Output:		B: have rest<n><n>Input: If you're the leader of a corporation what kinds of things are you not responsible for? Choices: <n>A: nothing, you are in complete control <n>B: all decisions involving human behavior <n>C: quality products and services <n>D: business operations, human resources, strategy and direction <n>E: all other departments <n>Output: (C) quality products and services<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Instruction<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>## Problem 5-1: What is a word problem?<n>### Instruction:Answer the question<n>Where in my house can I find a light fixture? <n>Give a step-by-step approach to solving this type of problem.<n><n>### Solution:<n>Step 0: Read the input.<n>Step 1: Identify the key words such as when, who, how many, where etc.<n>Step 2: Write the question in a sentence.<n>Step 3. Write the solution in a sentence.<n><n>## Problem5-2:<n>Write an if statement to solve the problem.<n><n>## Problem<n>What is the greatest common factor of 102, 164, 182?<n>## Step 1.<n>Identify the key words.<n>## Step 2.<n>write a question.<n>### Greatest common factor of two positive<n>number is the largest factor which is<n>common to them that is, it divides each of them and leaves no remainder (0).<n><n>##Step3.Write solution in a sentence. <n>The greatest factor is 4 and 102,164,182 are divisible by this. It is a 2 and a 4 digit.<n>The greatest common factor is 16.<n><sup>Note:</sup> It can be in decimal form for example, 0.8<n><n>Output:  The greatest common factor is 4.<n><n>## Problem:<n>How much money is in a box of pencils?<n>## Step 0: Read the output.<n>## Step 1: Identify key words:<n>Where, what, how much, how many, what is etc(depends on the sentence)<n>## Step 2: Write a sentence giving all the necessary information.<n>### Step 3: Write statement

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What state south of Kentucky and north of Alabama will you find people playing the fiddle? Choices:  A: alabama B: tennessee C: violin case D: music store E: bow and strings<n>Output:		B: tennessee<n><n>Input: 86% of the people that I will meet have blue hair? Choices: <n>Output: Yes or A<n><n>Output: No or B<n><n>Input : Are the two answers below equal? Choices:  yes or b<n>Output: A: yes and A: B<n>Output: A:B<n><n>Output: No and A:No<n>Input: Did the cowboy use a horse on his ranch? Choices: Choices:  yes: yes A: yes B: no C: maybe D: maybe <n>Output: yes or A<n><n>Input:  Choices: Choices  A : apple B: carrot C: grapes D: onion  E: peach or A:apple<n>Output: A:apple<n><n>```python3<n>def solution():<n><n>      n = int(input("Enter the number you want to check for 18"))<n><n>      if n in [1,2,3,4,5,6,7,8,9]:<n>               print("No numbers with 0,1,2,3 or 4 are missing")<n>      else:<n>               return "18 is the only prime number between 1 and 20"<n><n>if __name__ == '__main__':<n>  solution()

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:A person lived in my what? Choices:  A: demonstration B: conference C: building D: garage E: mouth<n>Output:		B: conference<n><n>#!/bin/bash<n>#bash<n><n>#input<n>#answers<n><n>read -p "what is an oil refinery? " -n 1 input<n><n><n>[[! $input =~ [^\n] ]] && echo $input && exit 0<n><n>if [[ $input == "A" ]]<n>then<n>echo "Correct!"<n>elif [[ $input == "B" ]]<n>then<n>    echo "Incorrect"<n>elif [[ $input = "C" ]]<n>then<n>  echo "Incorrect" <n>elif [[ $input =~ [D] ]]<n>then <n>  echo "Incomplete"<n>  #print "incomplete"<n>elif [[ $ = input =~ [E] ]]<n>then<n>  print "Incomplete"<n># print "Incorrect"<n><n><n>else<n>  echo "Incoming"<n>fi<n><n><n>#Input<n>#Answer<n><n>read -p  "what is the meaning of accomplishing" -n 1 input2<n><n>[[! $answers =~ [^\n] ]]* && echo $input2 && exit 0<n>if [[ $input2 = "A" ]]<n>  <n>then<n>echo  "Correct!"<n><n>elif<n><n>[[! $ = input2 =~ [B] ]] && echo "Infinite"<n>else<n>  echo"Infinite"<n>fi<n><n>else<n>    read -p "What do you write that a person doesn't use?" -n 1 input3<n>    if [[! $input =~ [D|E] ]]<n>    then<n>      echo $input <<EOF<n>  If $input3 contains input3 then write $answers<n>  else print "Infinite'<n>  fi<n><n>fi<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  (A: store) (B: restaurant) (C: on a plate) (D: on a book.)<n>Output: C: on a plate<n><n># Program to Implement the function<n><n>def solve():<n>		answers = []<n>		input_question = input()<n>		if input_question is None or input_question == "":<n>			sys.exit()<n>		question = re.split("(?<=\s)(\w+)",input_question)<n>		if(" " in question[2]):<n>			answer1 = question[2].split(" ")[0]<n>		else: <n>			answer2 = question[2] <n>		answers.append(answer2)<n>		<n>		input_answer = input()<n>	return answer<n><n>answers = solve()<n>print("\n".join(answers))<n>

A: fingernail salon  B: fingernail shop  C: fingernail bar  D: fingernail home  E: fingernail park<n>Output: E: fingernails park<n><n>#### Explain the problem<n><n>This puzzle, as with most of the puzzles in the book, is an example of [XOR puzzles](https://www.google.com/search?q=xor+puzzle), a type of [XOR-gate](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Exclusive_OR_gate).<n><n>Because we want all answer keys to be different and unique for each scenario, we need to use a binary XOR gate. The problem we face is that our answers are strings of multiple characters, and we need to be able to generate an XOR on each character of each word to perform the XOR gate. We need to be able to identify the number of letters used for each of the choices. Once we determine the number of characters we have per option, we need to construct the XOR gates using a shift register.<n><n>XOR-GATE WORKBOOK:<n><n>* To solve the XOR-Gate problem we will first make a shift register, called the XOR-gate. Each XOR-gate will have a read-only memory, a register, and an output register.<n><n>* The input registers are: 'where','what','where didn't you','when','why','where could you find','where might you find','what places of work','why did the person','can you think of a place'. <n><n>* The output registers are: '"oil refineries","when a person","on a pencil","where could you find","where did you","office","backpack","accomplishing","home","hair salon","at school","having a pencil"<n><n>* Each register is an

Define the basic operations of the conditional (aka logical) AND (&&) and OR (||).<n>##### Answer:<n>**The AND operator represents that we have to evaluate if both of the conditions are true.**<n><n>**The OR operator represents that we have<n>to evaluate if either of the conditions are true**<n><n>##### Question 2.	Define "true" and "false".<n>##### Answer:True means that your statement is valid as the output for the given input, false means that your expression is invalid as the output for the give input.<n><n>##### Question:3.	How do these operators return values?<n>##### Answer: They return a boolean value. True and False.<n><n>#####  Question 4:  What kind of statements and expressions can the logic engine evaluate?<n><n>##### Answer: The logic engine can evaluate simple logical statements, expressions, and statements wrapped in parenthesis.<n><n>##### Answer 5:Can you give examples of logic functions that you could write in the editor?<n>##### Answer : Ex: (A > 50 && B

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  E: very short A: intelligent B: a bit lazy C: overconfident D: shy<n>Output: B: a bit lazy<n><div id="code-panel"></div><n><n>```python<n>def word_in_sentence(word, sentence, vocab=() ):<n>		if vocab<=3:<n>			s1 =''.join(sorted(sentence.lower().split()))<n>			s2 =''.join(sentence.lower())<n>		if word in s1<n>			return True<n>		if word  in sent<n>			return False<n>		i = 1<n>		while i<=len(s1)-len(word)-1:<n>			vocab.append(s1[:i, i].count(word))<n>			i = j+1<n>		if "no" not in s1[:i, i]<n>			return not True<n>```<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What's the nickname of the monster the beauty loved? Choices:  A: beast B: ugly C: ugliness D: satellite E: top of mountain<n>Output:		B: beast<n><n>#### Explanation: The sentences must have no sentence fragments (no subject verb, or verb, preposition).<n><n>#### What is an example of a sentence fragment?<n><n>A)<n>A is a preposition. B)A is not a preposition. C)is has a verb. D)is the sentence fragment in the sentence example.<n><n>The sentence: "Lost in the desert, a boy went to a small pile of dried out plants" can be corrected to:<n><n>"Lost in the desert, a boy reached for a small pile of dry plants and hoped that he would find something useful." The second sentence is correct because "was" is a verb while "Lost" and "reached" are nouns, and the object of the preposition is a verb ("went").<n><n>The difference between a noun and a preposition is that a noun is describing a person, place, or thing, while a preposition describes a location, such as, "over there" or "between those two things." The sentence: "A red car ran to the store" has been corrected to: "A red car parked itself at the store."<n><n><n>### Instruction:In Exercises 4 to 20 correct, if possible, the sentences or the parts of sentences, which are labeled (T) for a term, (R) for a run-on, (U) for a question mark, or (B) for a quotation, so that each sentence is grammatical.<n><n>Input: A book was on my bed, I could not understand it. Choices:  A U B T B U A T<n><n>Output: B: A book was on on my bed, I couldn't understand it. A. This sentence doesn't contain a sentence fragment.<n><n>Input: The boy is eating a apple, and his sister and aunt, too.  Choices:  A R T B T U A T<n><n>#### Output: A. This sentence is grammatically incorrect, because the subject, "the boy" is split between two verbs.<n><n>#### In the question: "What will he do?" Who did he ask? Choices:  C T T A T R<n><n>#### Output: C T T A. The answer is "he asked" because "What will he do"

Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What has happened to a person's money after he or she has used the last of it? Choices:  A: dissipate B: flown C: disintegrate D: fall apart E: penultimate<n>Output:		A: dissipate<n><n>Input: Which of the following are not an actual type of fruit? Choices:  a: apple b: orange c: banana d: mango e: oink e: oink<n>Output: D: mango<n><n><n>### Instruction:<n>#The goal of this challenge is to answer some questions by finding the word that fits the given description.<n><n><n>### Challenge: [1](https://github.com/josephsiebe/RubyQuestions/blob/master/.codechallenge/question1.md)<n><n>### Challenge Instructions:<n>In case you forgot, I will give you a hint: the phrase does not contain the letters "f," "u," s," "t," "e," or "r."<n><n>### Challenge Question:<n>What is wrong with the following sentence?<n>```<n>You need to fill in the blanks below.<n>```<n>Output:<n>```<n>You have to be careful to use the correct letters: "a,b,c,d,e,f,g,h,i,j,k,l,m,n,e,r"<n>```<n><n>### Challenge Solution:<n>```<n>This sentence reads well, the letters in red are not used in a,b,c,etc.<n>```<n><n>## Solution:<n>```<n>- class Solution<n>  def getMissingLetters(sentence)<n>    missingLetters = %w(a b c d e f g h i j k l m n o r s t u v w x y z)<n>    pattern = /(\w#{missingLetters.join('.')})/<n>    pattern.match(sentence).captures.each do |word|<n>      replaceWordWithLetter = word.gsub(/\w/, '')<n>      replaceWordWithWord = word.gsub(/(\w+)/, replaceWordWithLetter)<n>    end<n>  end<n>end<n><n>def test_for_example<n>  sentence = "You need to fill in below"<n>  Solution.new.getMissingLetters(sence)<n>end<n>```

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:He curled up and tried to fall on his shoulder so his arm or what wouldn't take the hit? Choices:  A: leg B: garment C: torso D: body E: road<n>Output:		B: garment<n><n>Input: I believe I can find a way to explain. Choices:  A" goodness me" B: a better way C: a better word D: with a different technique E: without using jargon.<n>Output: A" goodness me".<n>#python<n><n>def main():<n>    n=input("What are your suggestions: ")<n>    if n=="A" or n=="B":<n>        print("You chose option A or B!","You got it!")<n>    elif n=="C" or n=="D":<n>        print("So, you chose option C or D!","Very good")<n>    elif n.lower() in ["e","d","c","b","a","t","s","r","g","l","h"]:<n>        print("Please write a valid input!")<n>    else:<n>        print("You did well!")<n><n>main()<n>

Choices:  A: pocket B: shower C: chemist D: drug store E: shaving kit<n>Output:		A: pocket<n><n>### Instruction:Write the method 'findTheMatch'. It should return the index of the word in the text that matches the given word. If there is no match, then `None` should be returned.<n>### Example<n>input = 'Where could you find some plumberry?'<n>matches = ['wall:','refineries:', 'water:', 'wouldn\'t:']<n># Output[0]: 0, output[1]: 3, output[2]: 1, output[3]: 5<n>output = findTheMatch(input, matches)<n>assert output == [3, 5]<n><n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:When you play around with your dog they will have? Choices:  A: alive B: health C: fun D: playing dead E: black<n>Output:		E: black<n><n>Input: What wouldn't you usually find in the bedroom of a teenager? Choices: 1. A: alarm clock<n>2.B: toothpaste<n>3.C: a pillow<n>4.D: bed<n>5.E: a bedroom<n>Output: D: bed<n><n><n>### Solution:<n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/python<n>class Solution:<n>    def findTheBestJob(self, s: str, i: int = 0, j: int = 0) -> int:<n>        if i > len(s) or j > len(s):<n>            return 0<n>        if not s[i].isdigit():<n>            i = f'{i - 1}{s[i]}{i + 1}'<n>        if i - 1 + j > len(s) - 1:<n>            j = f'{j - 1}{s.pop()}{j + 1}'<n><n>        count = [0, 0, 0]<n>        for i in range(j + 1, i + 1):<n>            count[1] += 1 if s[i] == '!' else 0<n>        print('count=', count)<n>        for i in s[:j]:<n>            count[0] += 1 if i == 1 else 0<n>        for j in range(i - 2, i, -1):<n>            count[-1] += 1<n>        count.sort()<n>        count = [item + 1 for item in count]<n>        if s[j] == 'C' or s[j] == 0:  # 0 for empty<n>            outc = i<n>        elif i - j <= 2:  # case 1<n>            outc = j<n>        elif j < i < 3:<n>            outc = 3<n>        elif s[i] == s[i + 1] == 'W':<n>            outc = min(i, j)<n>        elif len(s) > i + 1:  # case 2<n>            outc = int(''.join(s) + s[j:])<n>        else:<n>            outc, j2 = 0, j<n>            while j2 < len(s) -

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:The city's community garden was demolished for yet another what? Choices:  A: wasteland B: ocean C: desert D: parking lot E: flowers<n>Output:		B: ocean<n><n><n><n><n># Instruct and Test<n><n># import libraries<n>import sys<n>import re<n>import os<n>import itertools<n>import jieba<n><n>reload(sys)<n>sys.setdefaultencoding("utf8")<n><n><n><n><n>def split_string(string):<n>    # split the string by spaces in order to obtain the different words in the string for<n>    # word frequency and part of speech<n>    words = string.split()<n>    return words<n><n>def get_tag(string):<n>    words = []<n>    if len(string) >= 1:<n>        words = string.split(" ")<n>    else:<n>        return "X"<n><n>    for word in words:<n>        word = word.lower()<n>        if word == "":<n>            return ""<n><n>        words = jieba.cut(word)<n>        if len(words) >= 1:  # if no tags are found return X<n>            return list(set(words))[0]<n>    else:<n>       return "X"<n>    return tag + " " + str(len(tagged_words)) + " Tags and " + str(total_words) + " total words"<n>    <n><n><n>if len(sys.argv) == 2:<n>    filename = sys.argv[1]<n>else:<n>    print("usage: python2 part_of_speech.py data.txt\n\<n>           data.txt should be a plain text file containing your input")<n>    sys.exit()<n><n>if os.path.isfile(filename):  # verify that it is a text file<n>    file = filename<n>    print('Opening file:'+ file)<n><n>else:<n>    error = 'File Does Not Exist!'<n>    print(error)<n>    sys.exit(error)<n><n><n><n># reading the file<n>if os.path isfile(filename):<n><n>    file = open(filename,"r")<n>    line = file.readlines()<n>    file.close()<n>else:<n>    line = open(filename, "r")<n>else:<n>    file = open("", "r")<n>    lines = file.readlines();<n>    file.close();<n><n>for i in range(0,len(lines)):<n>    line = line[i]<n>

D: I can buy a house that doesn't have a stairway.  E: a car with no passengers is a __.<n><n>Output: A: car<n><n>Input: This is a list that is not all lists. Choices:  Choices B: This is a list. Choices:  a list B: This is a is not a. Choices: C: This is not a. Choice: D: There is a a book. E: The first list has as many elements as there are numbers in the book list. F: There is a book of books. G: There is a of book list. H: a book of list.<n><n>Output: D: There is no list,there is no book, there can be a book of list.

When you ask the sales guy how much is the truck? The s/he'll say: "I don't know, but the OEM is going to cost you $35,000" <n>What is WD-40 short for?<n>What year was the iPhone released?<n><n>Answers:  OEM = Original Equipment Maker.<n>W.D-40 = Water Displacement Formula 40 is the 40th variation of the compound formula.<n>iPhone was released in 2007.<n><n>#<n># SOLUTION<n>import re<n>import sys<n>scanner = re.Scanner(sys.stdin)<n>answers = []<n>def main():<n>	answers = scanner.scan(re.compile('[A-Za-z ]')).split()<n>	for i in range(len(answers)):<n>		if (answers[i] == None):<n>			print(str(i) +1, ": ", end=' ') <n>		else:<n>			print (str(i) + 1, ": ", answers[i], end=' ')<n>			if (i < (len(answers) -1)):<n>				print ('" ')<n>	<n>#######Instruction:Answer the multiple choice question<n><n>main()  #main() prints questions<n><n>#######Instructions:Answer the questions of questions asked without using Google and or any other resources.<n><n>questions = scanner.scan("\b".join('[A-z]?[a-z0-9]?\s?([^\W]+\W

Choices: 	A: find one in the store B: try the old one at least for a minute C: check what would it fit in D: read customer reviews E: none of these<n>Output: D: read customer reviews  <n><n>#### A: where the oil refinery would be of use<n><n>### B: when the person is tired.<n><n>### C: where the pens would be found<n><n><n>### D: What could I change the learning process<n><n><n>### E: Which product one should buy<n><n><br><br><n>:bookmark_tabs: Solution:<n><n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/env python<n><n>def answer1(q):<n>  if q == 'Where could you find some plumming that would not be of any use to you if you thirsty':<n>    return A, "oil refinery"<n>  else:<n>    return 'none of these'<n><n>def answer2(q):<n>   if q == 'When a person is beginning, what are they not doing yet':<n>      return 'accomplishing'<n>   else:<n>     return 'none of these.'<n><n>def answer3(q):<n>    if q == "Where might I find pens with the company logo?":<n>    return A, 'office'<n>   else: <n>    return 'none'<n><n>def answer4(q):<n>    return'very important'<n><n><n>def answer5(q):<n>   return "read customer reviews"<n><n><n><n>answers = (<n>   (answer1,"Where would the oil refinery be of any use to a thirsty person",<n>     "none"),<n><n>   (answer2, "when a person is beginning work what are they not doing",<n>     "they are tiredness"),<n><n><n>   (answer3, "where might i find pens with the company logos on them",<n>     "office"),<n><n><n>   # (answer4, "What would i do before buying a sofa", <n>     "none"),    <n> <n>   (answer5, "what can i change the learning process to", <n>     "very important"),<n>)<n><n>answered = ""<n><n>try:<n>    question = input()

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What is a place that might not always have a queen? Choices:  A: bee hive B: england C: castle D: deck of cards E: chess game<n>Output:		B: england<n><n><n>#### Solution<n><n>```python<n># Instalation<n>pip install -U flask flask-bootstrap<n>```<n><n>```pyhton<n>from flask import Flask, render_template, request, redirect, url_for,abort<n>from flask_bootstrap import Bootstrap<n>from flask_sqlalchemy import SQLAlchemy<n>from sqlalchemy.orm import exc<n>import time<n>import random<n>import string<n>```<n><n>```python<n>app=Flask(__name__)<n>app.secret_key="test"<n>app.config["SQLALCHEMY_TRACK_MODIFICATIONS"] = False<n>bootstrap = Bootstrap(app)<n>db=SQLAlchemy(app)<n><n><n>class QandAS(db.Model):<n>    question = db.Column(db.String(255),primary_key = True)<n>    answer = db.Column( db.String(256),db.ForeignKey('answers.id'))<n><n>class Answer(db.Model):   <n>    id=db.Column(db.Integer, db.ForeignKey('qandas.id')) #relationship with Question<n>    ans= db.Column(db.String(255))<n><n>#create table<n>db.create_all()<n><n><n>#show question details    <n>@app.route('/showquiz', methods=['GET'])<n>def showquiz():<n>    questions= QandAS.query.all()<n>     ans= Answer.query.all() <n>    return render_template('quiz.html',questions=questions,answers=ans)<n><n>def get_qno():<n>    qno=9999<n>quiz = QandAS(question= 'where does manure come from?')<n>quiz.answer=Answer(question = 'a farmer')<n>db.session.add(quiz)<n>db.session.commit()<n>ans=Answer(question='where is manure?')<n>ans.answer= quiz<n>db.session.save(ans)<n>db.session.__enter__()<n><n><n>#random question<n>@app.route("/quiz",methods=['GET', 'POST'])<n>def quiz():<n>    #add quiz data<n>    Qn= random.randint(0,99
### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? We will be answering these using different logic techniques. <n><n>First, we will answer the second question that is, "When a person is beginning work..." using a logical technique called "A truth Table" which is defined as: "A method of using truth tables and sets to analyze statements in propositional logic." (Wikipedia). This will help us analyze our question and help us find the correct answer(s). <n><n>By using this logical function we'll be using the logic "A" to help determine our answer options.<n><n>The next logical function we will use is called "Fuzzy" which is defined as "used to describe the process by which an unfinished task is completed or something that occurs after a period of time. (Google)" <n>Thus, helping us answer our question about "achievements" by using the logical function "B" to help describe our answer options.<n>Fuzzy can be either right or wrong as stated earlier as long as it is a "right answer" for our logic to use it correctly. <n><n>Once we have used the logical functions and determined all the options, we will be "eliminating" all the answers that are wrong as seen in the following diagram:<n><img src="../img/

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:James is very interested in other planets.  He loved the idea of going to mars, and reads books about it all the time.   He dreams of being on what? Choices:  A: love B: zoo C: school D: space shuttle E: library<n>Output:		A: love<n>			<n><n>#import <stdio.h><n>int main()<n>{<n>for(i = 0; i<4; i++)<n>{<n>printf("Input:\n");<n>scanf("%s", choice[i]) ;<n>printf("Output:\n");<n>for(j = 0; j<4; j++)<n>{<n>if(i==0 && j==0)<n>	printf("%s\n", answer[0]) ;<n>else if(i==0 && (j==1 || j==2 || j==3))<n>	printf("%s%c\n", choice[0],(i+1)%4-1) ;<n>else if((i+1)%3==0 && i!=0)<n>	printf(" \n") ;<n>else if(j==0 && i!=j)<n>	printf("%c\n", answer[j]) ;<n>printf(" %c\n", choice[(i+3)%4]) }<n>}<n>return 0 ; }<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:He found the blowfish off the coast of the Carolina's, it was where? Choices:  A: rock band B: sea of japan C: sushi restaurant D: fish market E: atlantic ocean<n>Output:		A: rock band<n><n># Part B<n><n>---<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the question<n>Write a program that will guess if the student is a freshman or senior.<n>The program will be tested if a test user will input the following:<n>1. the student's sex<n>2. their high school GPA<n>The program will make the guess of senior if the student has 3.7 or  above. and if the GPA is less than or equal 3.7 then the program will guess the student is a freshmen.<n><n>```python<n>high=3.7<n>grade=int(input("enter the students GPA: "))<n>sex=input("is the student male or female "+"S for female and M for male")<n>if grade<=high:<n>    class=student_freshmen()<n>elif grade>=high:<n>    class =student_senior()<n>else:<n>    class = "Not yet"<n>```<n><n><n><n>---<n><n># Coding Challenge<n><n>### Instructions:Write a program that will print out the following sentence:<n><n>The dog ran 15 miles and then it got the bone<n><n>### Your Challenge: <n>Write a program that counts the word occurrences using one variable and a separate variable for each word<n><n>### Code Review:<n>```python<n>The   dog  ran 15 miles  and  then  he  got  the  bone<n>```<n><n>---<n><n>---<n># Resources:<n><n>### Helpful URLs<n>* [Website](https://python.org/)<n>* [TechTalk](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZqwEIJOZn2U&ab_channel=Python)<n><n>

He was a clown, and acted very ridiculous.  This cheerfulness turned off people who expected the funeral to be what? ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:She a deep love for all her friends, every Friday she had an open invitation for them as she loved to host and what? Choices:  A: wait for B: eat out C: entertain D: please parents E: paint<n>Output:		D: please parents<n><n>Input: What is most used to be an object used to move an object from one place to another? Choices:  Q: bicycles A: cars B: rocket cars C: motorcycles D: train E: horse<n>Output: D: train<n><n>Input: If the person was lost at sea, what might some of their companions bring to their attention? Choices:  C: a large tree T: map T=tree<n>Output: T: a large tree<n>Answer:The function could be used as a helper function.<n>Let's start using the function as a helper function and move on to the more difficult questions as you work through them.<n><n><n>```python<n>#!/usr/bin/python<n><n>def read_and_correct(line2,choice): #takes the the line with choices and returns one or more choices<n>    while line2[-1]!= "\n": #read the line with choices and return a choice in the line<n>        for i in range(len(line2)):<n>            if line2[i] = "#": #if the line has a "#" inside in the line, split the words in the line in pairs<n>                words = line2[i:].split('#') #then do the split<n>            else: #if there isn't a "#", it's not a question so go to next line<n>                break<n>        if len(words) == 2: #if it's a pair of words, then check the pair of words<n>            if words[0][0] == "'": #if the first element of the pair is'then check if the second element of the pair is a question or not<n>                if words[0][1] in ("'",""): #if it is a question then<n>                    if words[1] == choice: #if it' a correct answer, the function goes right in the next line<n>                        try: #try is there to see if the user enters an answer for the question that is not a number, string or boolean<n>                            choice = (random.randint(1,20)+random.randint(0,99)) #if there is a number or a letter then<n>                        except: return choice #if it is not, then it goes to the next line<n>                    #else, the choice = random.rand

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What type of water transportation is human powered? Choices:  A: turn away B: let down C: have to sleep D: run E: row boat<n>Output:		E: row boat<n><n>Input: The color of my shoes? Choices:  color: blue  A: which are you wearing?  B: what are your socks? C: black D: your shoes? E: red<n>Output: B: what are your shoes?<n><n><n>#### Solution<n>```js<n>import { getAllAnswers, answerQuestions, isCorrectAnswer } from './index';<n><n>describe('check if the answer is correct', () => {<n>  it('input: Where could you find plumbing that would be no use to you if you were thirsty?', () => {<n>    let answer = 'ownhome';<n>    const correctAnswer = 'oilRefineries';<n>    const isCorrectAnswer = isCorrectAnswer(<n>      getAllAnswers('Where could you find plumb...'),<n>      correctAnswer,<n>      getAllAskedMultipleChoiceQuestions([answer])<n>    );<n>    console.log(isCorrectAnswer);<n>  });<n><n>  it('input : When a person is beginning to work, he is not:', () => {<n>   const correctAnswer = 'working';<n>    const isResultCorrect = answerQuestions(<n>      getAllInstructions(),<n>      getAllAggreements([<n>        { correctAnswer, answers: ['resting', 'tiredness'].map((a) => ({<n>          instruction: a,<n>          answer: a,<n>        }))<n>      ]).filter((a) => a.answer!== correctAnswer),<n>    )<n>    console.log('check result: ', isResultCorrect);<n>  });<n>});<n>```<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:What is a useful activity when experiencing loneliness? Choices:  A: meet people B: meet friend C: make people laugh D: socialize E: liquor<n>Output:		C: make people laugh<n><n>Input: Can you use soap when taking a shower? Choices: 	A: yes B: no C: maybe D: not sure E: maybe not<n>Output: A: yes<n><n>Input: Are there any plants that will be of use to someone who is thirsty? Choic: 	A: Yes. B: No. C: No. D: Yes. E: Cannot tell<n>Output: A: Yes<n><n># Questions To Be Answered:<n>   * How can you make an A, D,C,B, and E, be True?<n>   * The code below will loop through an array and create questions with a True False input.<n><n># Your Code:<n><n>def writeQuestions():<n>  questions = ['How can you use soap in a shower?',<n>              'Where could you find some plubming that would not be of any use to you if you have a drink? ',<n>              'Where might I find pens with the company logo?',<n>              'When a person is beginning work what aren\'t they doing?'<n>             'Where can you find a company logo?',<n>                'What is a useful activity to do when experiencing lonelness?',<n>                'Can you use soap when taking shower?']<n>#print questions<n><n>  flag = 0<n><n>  x=questions<n>  writeLine(x)<n><n>#For the question: How can you make an a, D,C, B and E be True?.<n>  for counter in range(0,len(x)):<n>   if statements=='Yes' :<n>     flag=0<n>   elif statements=='No' :<n>     flag = 1<n>   elif statements =='Maybe' :<n>     flag += 1 <n>   elif statements == 'Maybe not' :<n>     flag-= 1<n>   if flag==0:<n>   #print 'A'<n>   if x[counter] == 'Yes':<n>    writeLine(x[counter])<n>   elif x[counter] =='No':<n>   writeLine(x[couter] +'No')<n>   else:<n>   writeLine( x[counter] + 'Maybe')<n>   else: print writeLine(x[Counter])<n> elif flag==1:<n>  writeLine( 'D')<n>elif flag==2:<n>

The only constraint is that you must be able to submit it by the end of the day.<n><n>### Solution:<n><n>### Own home (1)<n><n><n>{% highlight Python %}<n>from helperFunctions import *<n>from operator import itemgetter<n><n>question = "where could you find some pluming that would not be of"<n>answers = ["oil refineries",<n>	"wall",<n>	"show",<n>	"water fountain",<n>	"own home"]<n><n>answer = getInt(answers, question)<n>if answer == 1: return "own home"<n>if answer == 2: return "wall"<n>if answer ==  3: return "show"<n>if answer == -1: return "wate fountain"<n>if answer ==-2: return "oil refinerieis"<n>return "error"<n>{% endhighlight %}<n><n>#### Solution<n><n>{% highlight Python %}{{answers[itemgetter("answer")(answers)]}}{{answers[itemgetver("answer")(answer)]}}<n><n><n>### A: working (2)<n><n><n>{% include../../lib/answers.rst %}<n><n>{% highlight Python -x %}<n>answers = ["beginning",<n>	"starting",<n>	"momentum",<n>	"accomplishing",<n>	"acquired",<n>	"reacquired",<n>	]<n><n>answer = getNum(answers, "When a person is beginning work...")<n>if answer == 0: return "momentum"<n>if answer ==1: return "accomplishing"<n>if answer ==2: return "beginning"<n>if answer ==3: return "movement"<n>return "acquired"<n>{% endhighlight %}{% highlight Python %}<n><n>### Solution<n><n>{% highlight python %}
