### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:The artist didn't use many colors to capture the view, he was famous for his very plain what? Choices:  A: landscape B: east side C: countryside D: middle america E: georgia<n>Output:		B: east side<n><n>Input:The carnival is a popular pastime. What is most common among the people? Choices:  C: amusement A: play B: entertainment C: work D: ride<n>Output: A: amusement and entertainment<n><n>The first step of your problem is to use regular expressions to extract the different data fields such as `work` and `resting`.  <n><n>The second step is to generate a unique ID for each of the combinations.  <n><n>The third step is to generate a random ID and create corresponding questions.  <n><n>The test cases should include a wide range of question-answer pairs. I've prepared several test cases to begin with.  <n><n>You can use any data structure you desire to store the questions as long as you return the questions at the end of your script.  <n><n>```plaintext<n>Input: When a boy is beginning work, what must he not do? <n>```<n>Your final answer should be `resting` as he cannot rest. `Work` is an option. All the other options have their own requirements, therefore, it isn't a requirement.<n><n>```plaintext <n>Input: Where can I find a bottle that contains no water?<n>```<n>Input: What can I find in a plumbing supply store?<n>```plaintext<n>A: oil refineries |<n>E: show |<n>B: wall |<n>D: own home |<n>C: plumbing |<n>A: own home |<n>E: show<n>```<n>#### My Solution: <n>```python<n>import re<n>from collections import Counter<n><n>def get_qna_from_string(question_string): <n>    question_string = re.sub('[\s]+','', question_string) <n>    question_and_answer_dict = dict() <n>    for word in (re.findall(r'[A-Z]+[?!]+', question_string)): <n>        if word not in question_and_answer: <n>            question_and_answer[word] = []<n>        if type(question_and_answer[question_and_answer.get(word, [])]) is list: <n>            question = word + '?'<n>            if word in ['work','resting']:<n>                question_and_answer = [word]<n>            question

Where Could You Find Some Plumbing That Wouldn’t Be Of Use To You If You Are Thirsty?<n><n>---<n><n>**Answer:** A: Oil Refineries  <n>**Explanation:**<n>Oil refineries are places that have massive amounts of plumbing that would be useless for quenching one's thirst.<n><n>---<n><n>Where Could You Find Some Plumbers That Would Tend To Be Taller?<n><n>---<n>   The only correct answer in this scenario...is B!  <n>   Plumbers? Plumbers are people who work in the plumbing industry. Thus, they will tend to be taller than you are.<n><n>## 2. When A Person Is Beginning Work, What Are All The Odd Things They Are Doing?<n><n>---<n>It depends on your job, but here is how it would affect me:<n><n>If you are not a college student, then you must be waking up...so that would be A.<n>If you are a college student, then your night of learning and studying was interrupted by the sun's rays and it is time to get to work.<n>If you are the boss, then your workday is interrupted by some little people, so B is correct.<n>If you work for the company, then B is correct because the boss is interrupting your morning.<n>Lastly, if you have an amazing boss that values you, then you only get to work (and get interrupted by the boss).<n><n>**Answer: **D: accomplishing <n><n>**Explanation**<n>You need to get to your job, home, the library, etc. in order to accomplish your day.<n><n>   <n><n>## 1.Where Might You Find Pens With A Company Logo<n><n>I would ask myself where my company puts the company logo and where I purchase the pens. That way I can get company-branded pens that I really want.<n><n>**Answer: */**<n>

Choices:  A: fridge B: limejuice C: square D: gym E: refrigerator<n>Output:		A: fridge<n><n>Input:When are the kids running? Choices:  T: after work hours U: early in the morning R: late at night I: afternoon A: evenings<n>Output: B: evening(R)<n>---<n>## Explanation<n>If you are thirsty then the plumbing you are talking about is not water(which is used to clean yourself). It is oil.  <n>If you are tired, you usually rest at home.<n>In order to get in shape, you should probably go to a gym.<n>The school provides a lot of pens(like the answer is) if you need them.<n>

Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:Dan said that getting in line was the best choice because it would lead to what? Choices:  A: being ordered B: less confusion C: boredom D: standing in line E: have to wait for<n>Output:		B: less confusion<n><n>Input:What's the best time to visit an arcade? Choices: 1) A: when there's no lines, and people won't judge 2) B: when the arcade opens 3) C: when no one you know will judge you 4) D: when arcade closes, and you just want to go home<n>Output: A] when there's no line, and people won'<n><n><n>**Note:<n><n>You can find answer in the github page.<n><n><n># Instruction2:<n><n>Follow the steps below to run the code. <n><n>```<n>cd 002<n>mkdir data<n>mkdir model<n>cd model<n><n>wget http://drive.google.com/uc?export=view&id=0B0DlLHxvHwGxZ2RWQmF0eUhZZkE<n>wget http://www.dropbox.com/tmp/w-sample.csv<n>wget http://bitbucket.org/jrj/jnnt-2-data/raw/9e5d50688bd7/sample.csv<n><n>wget bitbucket.org/jjvine/nlp-data/raw/master/snippets.txt<n>wget bitbucket/jcjvine/nlpnlp-data/raw/snippets.csv<n>mkdir model1<n>wget http://cs224d.stanford.edu/projects/natural-language-programming-2014-2015/assignment-4/nlp_data.zip<n>make tar.gz<n>```<n>```python<n>cd /Users/apple/nlp_course/course02<n>```<n>```python <n>cd data<n>wget http://dl.dropbox.com//16f2faf6/sentences.json<n>```<n><n># Tips.<n>1. ### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet? Choices:  A: working B: resting C: tiredness D: accomplishing E: momentum<n>Output: D: accomplishing<n><n>Input: Where might I find pens with a company logo? Choices:  A: office B: on a pencil C: write sentences on paper D: school E: backpack<n>Output: A: office<n><n>Input:Which long saga will we be watching on tonight's program? Choices:  A: concert B: opera C: theater D: take class E: television<n>Output:		A: concert<n><n>#### Why these choices?<n>The answers are all questions that start with "Where". The choices A, C, and D are adverb/preposition questions, while the other two questions are all verbs, which are all related with directions.<n><n>### Solution<n><n>* 解法一：<n><n>```python<n>def my_answer(input):<n>    return input.replace('Where', '')<n>```<n><n>简单地利用str接受一个字符串作为参数，再直接将其替换掉，最后return回去即可。<n><n>`my_answer('Where could you find some plumming that would not be of uae to you if you are stirthy?')`<n><n>**输出：** `A: oil refineries`<n><n>```python<n>assert(output==my_answer(input))<n>```<n><n>可以通过断言来测试，断言的规则是先输入字符串，再断言它所要到的正确结果。<n><n>- 断言用法整理后的代码如下：<n><n>```python| indent-8<n>import assertRaises<n>def my_answer(_input):<n>    assert my_answer(input) == output<n><n>assertRaises(AssertionError, my_answer.isnot('Where could you find something.?'))<n>```<n><n>`assertRaises`方法用于检查断言是否发生，如果没有，则调用断言方法，如果断言失败，则抛出异常。用断言的方式来判断输入是否合理。<n><n>#### 参考<n>[中国科学院计算所教育部大数据研究中心频道](https://ciihu36.com/2021-5-14-10-59-63/)；<n>

### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>Input: Where could you find some plumbing that would not be of use to you if you are thirsty? Choices:  A: oil refineries B: wall C: show D: own home E: water fountain<n>Output: A: oil refineries<n><n>Input: When a person is beginning work, what aren't they doing yet?
